critique: The document is an order from the President of the United States charging the Attorney-General with the superintendence and direction of all proceedings related to the seizure, prosecution, and condemnation of the property of rebels and traitors, as outlined in the Act of Congress of July 17, 1862. This involves instructing U.S. attorneys and marshals, authorizing them to call upon military officers for aid if resistance is feared, and requiring commanding officers to provide necessary support.
